value.title: How do you share your Power BI Dataset for someone to review?
value.excerpt: Need to have someone review your Power BI dataset for best practices and approval? Don't want to send them the full Power BI Desktop file and risk sharing data? Patrick walks you through some options that you have.  游닉 Become a member: https://guyinacu.be/membership   *******************  Want to

value.title: How to easily compare Server Timings using DAX Studio for your Power BI dataset
value.excerpt: Want to compare changes in your Power BI dataset? Making some amazing DAX optimizations? You should look at server timings in DAX Studio. value.title: How to handle Aggregation tables with Averages in Power BI
value.excerpt: Using Aggregation Tables in Power BI? Average calculations not working because they aren't hitting the agg? value.title: How to use the Power BI Aggregations Feature
value.excerpt: In this video, Adam sits down with Christian Wade to discuss how to use the Power BI Aggregations feature. This video will show you the clicks to get to the clicky clicky draggy droppy awesomeness when working with big data, or even massive data.   Christian Wade on Twitter - @_christianWade  LET'S CONNECT!

value.title: How we do the Screen Capture
value.excerpt: This is how we do the screen capture for our YouTube videos. For Guy in a Cube, we use Camtasia made by TechSmith, but there are other options.  Camtasia - https://www.techsmith.com/video-editor.html Free option with OBS Studio - https://obsproject.com/  ******** LET'S CONNECT! ********  -- http://twitter.com/guyinacube

value.title: Inside Power Query reference queries for Power BI and Excel
value.excerpt: Chris Webb joins Patrick to look at what happens when you use reference queries for Power Query. This applies to both Power BI and Excel. Chris also looks at how change the behavior to make things a bit faster.  Data Privacy Blog: https://blog.crossjoin.co.uk/2018/12/27/data-privacy-settings-data-refresh-performance-power-bi-excel/

value.title: Install and configure Power BI Report Server (May 2017 Preview)
value.excerpt: In this video, I look at how to install and configure the May 2017 Preview of Power BI Report Server. Power BI Report Server has a new standalone install experience and this product allows for Power BI reports to be rendered in the web portal along with paginated reports.  This will get you started with
value.featuredContent: <iframe width="800" height="500" frameborder="0" src="https://www.youtube.com/embed/zacaEb9A4F0" allow="accelerometer; autoplay; encrypted-media; gyroscope; picture-in-picture" allowfullscreen></iframe>

value.title: It's time to free your Power BI data model! We freed up 83%!?!
value.excerpt: We reduced a Power BI dataset size by 83% by doing one simple thing. It's time to get serious about your data model!  Download Sample: https://guyinacu.be/splitdatetimesample  游닉 Become a member: https://guyinacu.be/membership   *******************  Want to take your Power BI skills to the next level?

value.title: Link from a Power BI Paginated report to a Power BI report
value.excerpt: Patrick looks at how you can add a link to your Power BI Paginated report and open a Power BI report while passing filters over to explore data.  LET'S CONNECT!  Guy in a Cube -- https://guyinacube.com -- http://twitter.com/guyinacube -- http://www.facebook.com/guyinacube -- Snapchat - guyinacube --

value.title: Migrate your Paginated reports to Power BI
value.excerpt: Are your paginated reports still on-premises with either Power BI Report Server or SQL Server Reporting Services? Want to move them to Power BI? Patrick shows you how you can do that using the RDLMigration tool!  Documentation: https://docs.microsoft.com/power-bi/guidance/migrate-ssrs-reports-to-power-bi
value.featuredContent: <iframe width="800" height="500" frameborder="0" src="https://www.youtube.com/embed/_VaBzheAgxY" allow="accelerometer; autoplay; encrypted-media; gyroscope; picture-in-picture" allowfullscreen></iframe>

value.title: Minimize diagnostics steps by just using the VPAX file!
value.excerpt: Getting a VPAX and BIM or PBIT file is key to helping optimize your Power BI dataset. We look at them all the time. Patrick shows how you can simplify this by just using the VPAX file!  DAX Studio: https://daxstudio.org  Tabular Editor: https://tabulareditor.com/  游닉 Become a member: https://guyinacu.be/membership
value.featuredContent: <iframe width="800" height="500" frameborder="0" src="https://www.youtube.com/embed/owSaH3DlRrw" allow="accelerometer; autoplay; encrypted-media; gyroscope; picture-in-picture" allowfullscreen></iframe>

value.title: Multiple sign-ins using Chrome with Power BI or Office 365
value.excerpt: In this video, I show you how you can use Chrome to have multiple logins to Power BI, or Office 365, without using incognito, or in-private or anything else.  This was a tip I got from Chris Webb, who found it from James Callaghan.  Chris Webb's Blog: https://blog.crossjoin.co.uk/2017/03/23/quick-tip-working-with-multiple-power-bi-subscriptionsaccounts/
value.featuredContent: <iframe width="800" height="500" frameborder="0" src="https://www.youtube.com/embed/gHEFK4ol5XI" allow="accelerometer; autoplay; encrypted-media; gyroscope; picture-in-picture" allowfullscreen></iframe>

value.excerpt: Power BI Desktop has new Artificial Intelligence (AI) capabilities in the November 2019 release. Sarina Stevens shows us what it is all about! value.title: New Contoso Sample app for Power BI Embedded
value.excerpt: There is a new Power BI Embedded sample application called Contoso Sales. The best part? The source code is available out on GitHub! Adam walks you through the sample application.  Contoso Sales Embedded Demo GitHub Repo https://github.com/microsoft/Power-BI-Embedded-Contoso-Sales-Demo  Contoso Sales

value.title: OData Differences within Power BI and how to refresh your data!
value.excerpt: Last week we looked at the O365 Bubble and how we use Authentication to go in and out.  This week we show it in action!  We will look at one of the limitations to the existing Power BI service and how we can actually use the new Power BI Preview service to refresh data from an OData feed using oAuth

value.title: One little change to improve Power BI slicer performance (BANANAS!!!)
value.excerpt: Patrick shows how you can make one little change to your Power BI slicers to improve report performance. It's bananas! value.title: 'OraOLEDB.Oracle' provider is not registered
value.excerpt: Highlights an issue that could occur when creating a Data Source within Power BI Admin Center.  Oracle Provider downloads -  64-bit Oracle Data Access Components (ODAC) http://www.oracle.com/technetwork/database/windows/downloads/index-090165.html  32-bit Oracle Data Access Components (ODAC) http://www.oracle.com/technetwork/topics/dotnet/utilsoft-086879.html

value.title: Personal Gateway governance in Power BI
value.excerpt: Gateway sprawl in Power BI can be a problem for organizations looking to govern what data can be refreshed. Learn how you can govern the Personal Gateway to keep it under control.  Set-DataGatewayTenantPolicy PowerShell Reference https://docs.microsoft.com/powershell/module/datagateway/set-datagatewaytenantpolicy?view=datagateway-ps

value.title: Power BI Desktop: How to find the native query after query folding
value.excerpt: Have you wondered how to find the native query in Power BI Desktop after query folding does its thing? Do you even know what query folding is? In this video, Adam looks at how you can find the query that will be sent to your data source and a few things to be aware of. This applies to Power Query in

value.title: Power BI For Report Consumers
value.excerpt: In this video, we look at Power BI for report consumers. Those folks that maybe don't author reports, but just view reports within Power BI. We introduce some basic Power BI concepts and introduce you to areas of the Power BI service to get you familiar with the portal.  LET'S CONNECT!  Guy in a Cube

value.title: Power BI Paginated Reports: Visualizing Data
value.excerpt: Paginated reports in Power BI are now available. Now that you have data, Patrick walks you through how to build a matrix visual within the report. He also looks at how to work with expressions and formatting.  LET'S CONNECT!  Guy in a Cube -- https://guyinacube.com -- http://twitter.com/guyinacube --

value.title: Power BI parameters - Updating in the Power BI Service or with APIs
value.excerpt: In this video, Adam looks at how you can update Power BI parameters within the service or by using APIs. You can create Power BI Parameters within Power BI Desktop using Power Query. Then you can update those Power BI parameters once the report is published to the Power BI service.  PowerShell Samples:
value.featuredContent: <iframe width="800" height="500" frameborder="0" src="https://www.youtube.com/embed/MJVSu47iMmo" allow="accelerometer; autoplay; encrypted-media; gyroscope; picture-in-picture" allowfullscreen></iframe>

value.title: Power BI Reports and Buttons (new with Power BI Desktop - April 2018)
value.excerpt: In this video, Patrick looks at Power BI reports and buttons. Buttons were added to Power BI Desktop in the April 2018 release. You can now add buttons to your Power BI reports and configure actions for when they are selected.  Bookmarks and selections are a powerful combination with Power BI reports

value.title: Report level measures with Power BI live connections
value.excerpt: In this video, Patrick looks at how you can create report level measures, within Power BI Desktop, against SQL Server Analysis Services Tabular live connections, or against a Power BI service dataset live connection. He also explains what is meant by report level measures. Bust out your DAX toolbelt

value.excerpt: You should be reviewing performance of your Power BI Reports. This report from Smart Power BI helps you to visualize the results of Performance Analyzer. Let's check it out!
